definitions: punctuation mark consisting of two dots placed one above the other used to introduce explanations lists or quotations
major part of the large intestine that extends from the small intestine to the rectum
examples: The recipe listed ingredients after a colon
Use a colon before introducing a direct quote
The doctor examined the patient's colon for signs of disease
A healthy colon absorbs water and nutrients from digested food

definitions: young male horse especially one less than four years old
brand of revolver or pistol originally manufactured by Samuel Colt
examples: The colt stayed close to its mother in the pasture
They trained the colt to accept a saddle and bridle
The sheriff carried an old Colt revolver in his holster
The museum displayed vintage Colt firearms from the Wild West

definitions: Christian religious service in which bread and wine are consumed to commemorate the Last Supper
intimate fellowship or rapport between people sharing common feelings experiences or beliefs
examples: The congregation gathered for Sunday morning communion
She took her first communion at age seven
They felt a deep communion with nature during the hike
The artists shared a communion of creative spirits

definitions: process of managing and adapting to difficult or stressful situations circumstances or emotions
protective cap or covering on top of a wall to prevent water damage
examples: Learning healthy coping mechanisms helped her manage anxiety
Coping with loss takes time and emotional support
The mason installed stone coping along the garden wall
Rain damaged the wall where the coping had cracked

definitions: reddish-brown metallic chemical element used in electrical wiring and plumbing
reddish-brown color resembling the metal copper
informal term for a police officer especially in British English
examples: The electrician installed copper wiring throughout the house
Copper pipes are resistant to corrosion and bacteria
She painted the sunset with brilliant copper tones
His hair had natural copper highlights in sunlight
The copper on the beat knew everyone in the neighborhood
Several coppers arrived to break up the disturbance

definitions: small group or thicket of trees or bushes growing close together
examples: Birds nested in the copse at the edge of the field
They discovered wild mushrooms growing in the shady copse

definitions: sexual union between two organisms especially the insertion of the male reproductive organ into the female
examples: The biologist studied copulation behaviors in various animal species
Successful copulation leads to reproduction in most mammals

definitions: person who copies or imitates the behavior actions or work of another
examples: The younger sibling was a copycat who mimicked everything
Several copycat crimes occurred after the news coverage

definitions: act or process of making a duplicate or reproduction of something
examples: Copying homework assignments violates academic integrity policies
The office assistant spent hours copying documents for distribution

definitions: person who makes written copies especially of manuscripts or musical scores before printing was common
examples: Medieval copyists preserved ancient texts in monastery scriptoriums
The copyist carefully transcribed the composer's handwritten score

definitions: person who writes text for advertisements marketing materials or promotional content
examples: The copywriter created catchy slogans for the new campaign
She worked as a freelance copywriter for several agencies

definitions: hard stony substance secreted by certain marine polyps forming reefs and islands in warm seas
pinkish-orange color resembling certain types of coral
examples: Divers explored the vibrant coral reef teeming with fish
Climate change threatens coral ecosystems around the world
She wore a coral dress that complemented her skin tone
The sunset painted the sky in shades of coral and gold

definitions: sweet flavored alcoholic or non-alcoholic drink often fruit-based
warm and friendly manner or atmosphere
examples: She served elderflower cordial to the garden party guests
The bartender mixed gin with lime cordial
Despite their disagreement, they maintained cordial relations
The host extended a cordial welcome to all visitors

definitions: line or circle of police soldiers or guards preventing access to or from an area
examples: Police established a cordon around the crime scene
Security personnel formed a cordon to control the crowd

definitions: durable cotton fabric with vertical ribs or wales on the surface
examples: He wore corduroy pants that made a swishing sound when walking
The vintage corduroy jacket had wide wales and deep pockets

definitions: small herding dog breed with short legs and fox-like face originating from Wales
examples: The Queen's corgis were famous throughout the United Kingdom
Their corgi loved to herd children around the backyard

definitions: aromatic plant whose leaves and seeds are used as herbs and spices in cooking
examples: Fresh coriander leaves added flavor to the curry dish
She ground coriander seeds for the spice mixture

definitions: cylindrical stopper for bottles made from bark of the cork oak tree
thick spongy bark of the cork oak tree harvested for various uses
examples: He pulled the cork from the wine bottle with a loud pop
The champagne cork flew across the room during celebration
Portugal produces most of the world's cork from oak forests
Cork flooring provides natural insulation and cushioning

definitions: something or someone remarkably good excellent or impressive
examples: The final goal was a real corker that won the match
She told a corker of a joke that had everyone laughing

definitions: device with a spiral metal rod for pulling corks from bottles
examples: The waiter used a corkscrew to open the wine bottle
She kept a small corkscrew in her picnic basket

definitions: bread made from cornmeal popular in Southern United States cuisine
examples: She served warm cornbread with butter and honey
Cornbread crumbles perfectly into a bowl of chili

definitions: transparent layer forming the front of the eye covering the iris and pupil
examples: The ophthalmologist examined her cornea for signs of damage
Contact lenses sit directly on the cornea's surface

definitions: defensive player in American football who covers wide receivers
examples: The cornerback intercepted the pass intended for the receiver
Teams need fast cornerbacks to defend against passing plays

definitions: stone that forms the base of a corner of a building joining two walls
indispensable and fundamental basis or foundation of something
examples: They laid the cornerstone during the building's dedication ceremony
The ancient cornerstone bore inscriptions from centuries ago
Trust forms the cornerstone of any successful relationship
Education remains the cornerstone of economic development

definitions: brass musical instrument similar to a trumpet but shorter and wider
examples: She played a beautiful solo on the cornet during the concert
The marching band featured several cornets in the brass section

definitions: field where corn or maize is grown as a crop
examples: The children played hide-and-seek in the tall cornfield
Crows gathered to feed in the harvested cornfield

definitions: coarse flour made from dried corn used in cooking and baking
examples: She dusted the pizza pan with cornmeal before adding dough
Cornmeal gives fried fish a crispy golden coating

definitions: decorative horn-shaped container overflowing with fruit flowers and grain symbolizing abundance
abundant supply or source of good things
examples: The Thanksgiving table featured a cornucopia centerpiece
Artists often depicted cornucopias in harvest festival paintings
The farmers market offered a cornucopia of fresh produce
The library provided a cornucopia of resources for researchers

definitions: proposition that follows from and is often appended to one already proved or statement that naturally follows from something else
examples: Increased rainfall is a corollary of climate change in some regions
The corollary to this theorem appears in the next chapter

definitions: outermost region of the sun's atmosphere visible during a solar eclipse
circular crown or halo of light around a celestial body
examples: Scientists studied the sun's corona during the total eclipse
The corona extends millions of kilometers into space
A beautiful corona appeared around the moon on the frosty night
The corona discharge created a glowing effect around the wire

definitions: relating to the arteries that supply blood to the heart muscle
examples: The patient underwent coronary bypass surgery last month
Coronary artery disease remains a leading cause of death

definitions: ceremony of crowning a sovereign or their consort marking the formal investiture with regal power
examples: The coronation of Queen Elizabeth II took place in 1953
Thousands gathered to witness the historic coronation ceremony

definitions: official who investigates violent unnatural or suspicious deaths to determine cause
examples: The coroner examined the body to determine cause of death
She worked as a county coroner for twenty years

definitions: small crown worn by nobility ranking below the sovereign typically indicating rank
examples: The duchess wore a jeweled coronet to the state banquet
Medieval paintings often depicted nobles wearing coronets

definitions: shortened form of corporation used in company names
examples: Microsoft Corp announced record quarterly earnings yesterday
She works for a tech corp in Silicon Valley

definitions: non-commissioned officer ranking above private and below sergeant in armed forces
examples: The corporal led his squad through the training exercise
She earned promotion from private to corporal after basic training

definitions: dead body of a human being
examples: Detectives examined the corpse for evidence at the crime scene
The ancient corpse was remarkably preserved in the ice

definitions: pen or enclosure for horses cattle or other livestock
examples: Cowboys herded the cattle into the corral for branding
The wooden corral needed repairs after the storm damage

definitions: something intended to correct or counteract something harmful or undesirable
examples: The teacher suggested corrective exercises for her poor posture
The company implemented corrective measures after the audit

definitions: thing or phenomenon that has a mutual relationship or connection with another
examples: Researchers found sleep quality was a strong correlate of academic performance
Income level often serves as a correlate of educational attainment

definitions: communication by exchanging letters emails or other written messages
close similarity connection or equivalence between things
examples: Their correspondence lasted for decades through handwritten letters
The secretary manages all business correspondence for the office
Scientists noted the correspondence between the two data sets
There was clear correspondence between effort and results

definitions: evidence or information that confirms or supports a statement theory or finding making it more certain
examples: The witness testimony provided corroboration for the defendant's alibi
Scientists sought corroboration of their findings through repeated experiments

definitions: gradual destruction or deterioration of materials especially metals by chemical reaction with environment
examples: Salt water accelerated corrosion of the bridge's steel beams
Regular maintenance prevents corrosion in industrial equipment

definitions: substance capable of destroying or eating away materials through chemical action
examples: Workers wore protective gear when handling corrosive chemicals
The corrosive leaked from its container and damaged the floor
